result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

PLEA:

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding. Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
21CM316:
Ct. 1 (Hit and Run)>>Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: $300 Fine plus Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Restitution in the amount of $500.00 to be paid at the rate of at least $25/Month, Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended. 

21CT299:
Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: $1,744 fine inclusive, DNA Sample. 45 Days MCJ w/Huber/EMP privileges for work/family care, Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 24 Months, as is the defendant herself, and device to be installed immediately; 1/2 price IID installation fee to be paid; 24 Month dl revocation with any administrative credit; AODA and Follow up, Comply with any rules and conditions of CPS pursuant to 22CM11, Counseling/Assessment/Treatment as recommended. Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, Court finds 29 Days Credit. Defendant has 45 Days to report to MCJ to serve sentence. 

22CF1051:
Ct. 1 (OWI (4th w/ Passenger <16 Years Old))>> Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: $600 Fine plus Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. 6 Months MCJ w/Huber/EMP privileges for work/family care, Concurrent to jail term in 21CT299, Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 4 Years, as is the defendant herself, and device to be installed immediately; 1/2 price IID installation fee to be paid; 4 Year dl revocation with any administrative credit; AODA and Follow up, Comply with any rules and conditions of CPS pursuant to 22CM11, Counseling/Assessment/Treatment as recommended. Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, Court finds 29 Days Credit. Defendant has 45 Days to report to MCJ to serve sentence.
